intro: Ortholobium bubalinum, commonly known as the wild indigo. It is a leguminous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It has a taproot system and often grows in disturbed soils, making it a pioneer species in certain ecosystems. Its seeds are encased in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
